txt.en:
'This bridge leads to the island of Tyl Annûn, the home of our most valued crypt and the former palace. The torches along the bridge burn blue in memory of the fallen kings.

'It was custom to sprinkle incense into the flames as you crossed the bridge. The scent would waft into the palace and honour the leaders.

'I encourage you to partake in this practice.'
'I smelled the incense, and I am sure they did as well. My ancestors and kings have been respected and honoured.'
The torches burning along the bridge are used to honour the fallen leaders of Annúminas.
Burn incense in the torches on the bridge leading to Tyl Annûn.
Orchalwë will be pleased to hear his ancient kings have been honoured.
